Name: Stela of Ha-ankhef
Description: The stela is divided into four separate sections. The lunette contains three lines of an inscription. Underneath is a man on the left, seated in front of an offering table, with a man and a woman kneeling in front of him on the ground. Registers three and four have the same motif: three and four kneeling men respectively, facing right. In the third register a woman with a lotus flower in her hand is kneeling on the right, facing them. Each man is holding a napkin in his hand. There are texts above the heads and beside the depicted figures. The stela has a wide, carved line at its bottom edge.
